summary.long: Habakkuk is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Jehovah, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear? I cry out unto thee of violence, and thou wilt not save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why dost thou show me iniquity, and look upon perverseness? for destruction and violence are before me; and there is strife, and contention riseth up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the law is slacked, and justice doth never go forth; for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore justice goeth forth perverted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold ye among the nations, and look, and wonder marvellously; for I am working a work in your days, which ye will not believe though it be told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, that march through the breadth of the earth, to possess dwelling-places that are not theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are terrible and dreadful; their judgment and their dignity proceed from themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their horses also are swifter than leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves; and their horsemen press proudly on: yea, their horsemen come from far; they fly as an eagle that hasteth to devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They come all of them for violence; the set of their faces is forwards; and they gather captives as the sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, he scoffeth at kings, and princes are a derision unto him; he derideth every stronghold; for he heapeth up dust, and taketh it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall he sweep by as a wind, and shall pass over, and be guilty, even he whose might is his god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art not thou from everlasting, O Jehovah my God, my Holy One? we shall not die. O Jehovah, thou hast ordained him for judgment; and thou, O Rock, hast established him for correction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou that art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and that canst not look on perverseness, wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy peace when the wicked swalloweth up the man that is more righteous than he;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taketh up all of them with the angle, he catcheth them in his net, and gathereth them in his drag: therefore he rejoiceth and is glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he sacrificeth unto his net, and burneth incense unto his drag; because by them his portion is fat, and his food plenteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall he therefore empty his net, and spare not to slay the nations continually?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will stand upon my watch, and set me upon the tower, and will look forth to see what he will speak with me, and what I shall answer concerning my complaint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah answered me, and said, Write the vision, and make it plain upon tablets, that he may run that readeth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the vision is yet for the appointed time, and it hasteth toward the end, and shall not lie: though it tarry, wait for it; because it will surely come, it will not delay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, his soul is puffed up, it is not upright in him; but the righteous shall live by his faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, moreover, wine is treacherous, a haughty man, that keepeth not at home; who enlargeth his desire as Sheol, and he is as death, and cannot be satisfied, but gathereth unto him all nations, and heapeth unto him all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall not all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting proverb against him, and say, Woe to him that increaseth that which is not his! how long? and that ladeth himself with pledges!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shall they not rise up suddenly that shall bite thee, and awake that shall vex thee, and thou shalt be for booty unto them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because thou hast plundered many nations, all the remnant of the peoples shall plunder thee, because of men’s blood, and for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all that dwell therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to him that getteth an evil gain for his house, that he may set his nest on high, that he may be delivered from the hand of evil!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast devised shame to thy house, by cutting off many peoples, and hast sinned against thy soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the stone shall cry out of the wall, and the beam out of the timber shall answer it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to him that buildeth a town with blood, and establisheth a city by iniquity!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, is it not of Jehovah of hosts that the peoples labor for the fire, and the nations weary themselves for vanity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory of Jehovah, as the waters cover the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto him that giveth his neighbor drink, to thee that addest thy venom, and makest him drunken also, that thou mayest look on their nakedness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou art filled with shame, and not glory: drink thou also, and be as one uncircumcised; the cup of Jehovah’s right hand shall come round unto thee, and foul shame shall be upon thy glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the violence done to Lebanon shall cover thee, and the destruction of the beasts, which made them afraid; because of men’s blood, and for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all that dwell therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What profiteth the graven image, that the maker thereof hath graven it; the molten image, even the teacher of lies, that he that fashioneth its form trusteth therein, to make dumb idols?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe unto him that saith to the wood, Awake; to the dumb stone, Arise! Shall this teach? Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver, and there is no breath at all in the midst of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jehovah is in his holy temple: let all the earth keep silence before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, set to Shigionoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God came from Teman,
And the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah
His glory covered the heavens,
And the earth was full of his praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Before him went the pestilence,
And fiery bolts went forth at his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction;
The curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Was Jehovah displeased with the rivers?
Was thine anger against the rivers,
Or thy wrath against the sea,
That thou didst ride upon thy horses,
Upon thy chariots of salvation?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The sun and moon stood still in their habitation,
At the light of thine arrows as they went,
At the shining of thy glittering spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou didst march through the land in indignation;
Thou didst thresh the nations in anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people,
For the salvation of thine anointed;
Thou woundest the head out of the house of the wicked man,
Laying bare the foundation even unto the neck. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thou didst tread the sea with thy horses,
The heap of mighty waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I will rejoice in Jehovah,
I will joy in the God of my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehovah, the Lord, is my strength;
And he maketh my feet like hinds’ feet,
And will make me to walk upon my high places.
For the Chief Musician, on my stringed instruments.
verses.speaker: Narrator
